meanings.definition: Electromagnetic radiation with wavelengths longer than visible light but shorter than microwaves.
meanings.sent1: The infrared helps us see things that are too far away for our eyes.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use infrared to study objects in space.
meanings.sent3: The infrared decided to take a vacation and left the visible light in charge.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like infrared, warming her heart from a distance.
meanings.sent5: The infrared glow of the sunset painted the sky in soft hues.

meanings.definition: A device that detects infrared radiation.
meanings.sent1: The infrared can spot heat even in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The infrared is a useful tool for night vision.
meanings.sent3: The infrared went on strike, refusing to detect any more heat.
meanings.sent4: His intuition was like an infrared, sensing danger before it was visible.
meanings.sent5: The infrared camera captured the hidden movements of the animals in the forest.

meanings.definition: Emitting or relating to infrared radiation.
meanings.sent1: The infrared light warms the chilly room.
meanings.sent2: The infrared sensor helps maintain the temperature.
meanings.sent3: The infrared party was a hit, everyone felt cozy and warm.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an infrared beam, spreading warmth to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The infrared glow of the fire made the room feel inviting.
